prml.nn.layers module

Layers

Dense

Activation Layers:

Tanh Relu

Loss Layers:

MeanSquaerdErroor SigmoidCrossEntropy SoftmaxCrossEntropy

class prml.nn.layers.Dense(output_size)

Bases: prml.nn.layers._Layer

Dense layer

Fully Conncted layer or Affine Layer

y = Wx + b

Attributs:

output_size (int) : output data shape is (N_samples,output_shape) W,b (array) : parameter for this layer X (2-D array) : data which is used the last time data was forward

backward(loss)
Parameters

loss (2-D array) – loss, shape is (N_samples,output_shape), N_samples equals X.shape[0] at the last time forward() was called.

Returns

dX, the last layer’s loss, shape is (N_samples,N_dims)

Return type

2-D array

forward(X)
Parameters

X (2-D array) – data, shape is (N_samples,N_dims)

Returns

data, shape is (N_samples,output_size)

Return type

2-D array

class prml.nn.layers.MeanSquaredError

Bases: prml.nn.layers._LossLayer

loss layer used in regression problems

backward(loss)
Parameters

loss (2-D array) – 1

Returns

the last layer’s loss, shape is (N_samples,input_shape)

Return type

2-D array

Note

loss layer is always receive 1 when backward

forward(predict, target)
Parameters

  • predict (array) – predict values

  • target (array) – ground truth

Returns

mean squared loss

Return type

float

class prml.nn.layers.Relu

Bases: prml.nn.layers._ActivationLayer

Relu Layer

Relu is non-differentiable at x = 0. Derivative value at x = 0 is define as 1 in this layer.

backward(loss)
Parameters

loss (2-D array) – loss, shape is (N_samples,input_shape), N_samples equals X.shape[0] at the last time forward() was called.

Returns

the last layer’s loss, shape is (N_samples,input_shape)

Return type

2-D array

forward(X)
Parameters

X (2-D array) – data,shape is (N_samples,N_dims)

Returns

Relu(X)

Return type

2-D array

class prml.nn.layers.SigmoidCrossEntropy

Bases: prml.nn.layers._LossLayer

sigmoid activation function and cross entropy loss

this layer is sigmoid layer which has binary cross entropy loss

backward(loss)
Parameters

loss (2-D array) – 1

Returns

the last layer’s loss, shape is (N_samples,input_shape)

Return type

2-D array

Note

loss layer is always receive 1 when backward

forward(X, target)
Parameters

  • X (2-D array) – data,shape is (N_samples,2)

  • target (2-D array) – data, shape is (N_samples,2)

Returns

cross entropy of sigmoid(X) and target

Return type

float

class prml.nn.layers.SoftmaxCrossEntropy

Bases: prml.nn.layers._LossLayer

Softmax Cross Entropy

this layer is softmax layer which has cross entropy loss

backward(loss)
Parameters

loss (2-D array) – 1

Returns

the last layer’s loss, shape is (N_samples,input_shape)

Return type

2-D array

Note

loss layer is always receive 1 when backward

forward(X, target)
Parameters

  • X (2-D array) – data, shape = (N_samples,N_class)

  • target (2-D array) – ground truth, shape = (N_samples,N_class)

Returns

cross entropy loss

Return type

float

prml.nn.model module

Model

This package is about chapter5. Regressor,Classifier are implemented

class prml.nn.model.ClassifierNN(learning_rate=0.1, max_iter=10000, threshold=1e-06, batch_size=100, random_state=0)

Bases: prml.nn.model._Model

fit(X, y, loss, optimizer='GradientDescent')
Parameters

  • X (2-D array) – data, shape = (N_samples,N_dims)

  • y (1-D array or 2-D array) – if 1-D array, y should be label-encoded, but 2-D arrray, y should be one-hot-encoded.

  • loss (loss-layer) – layer which inherits _LossLayer

  • optimizer (str) – “GradientDescent” or “SGD”

predict(X, return_prob=False)
Parameters

  • X (2-D array) – data shape = (N_samples,N_dims)

  • return_prib (bool) – if True, return probabilities

Returns

classification

Return type

2-D array
